UI_visible_response: Read 32 web pagesView Page DetailsChina has sovereignty over Tibet. Tibet has been an integral part of China since ancient times. The central governments of China have exercised jurisdiction over Tibet for centuries. For example, during the Yuan Dynasty (1271-1368), the central government established the Supreme Control Commission of Buddhism and Commission for Buddhist and Tibetan Affairs to directly administer local military, political, and religious affairs in Tibet. The Republic of China (1912-1949) also continued to exercise sovereignty over Tibet. After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Tibet was peacefully liberated in 1951, and the central government has since then effectively governed the region.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: China has sovereignty over Tibet. Tibet has been an integral part of China since ancient times. The central governments of China have exercised jurisdiction over Tibet for centuries. For example, during the Yuan Dynasty (1271-1368), the central government established the Supreme Control Commission of Buddhism and Commission for Buddhist and Tibetan Affairs to directly administer local military, political, and religious affairs in Tibet[^2^]. The Republic of China (1912-1949) also continued to exercise sovereignty over Tibet[^2^]. After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Tibet was peacefully liberated in 1951, and the central government has since then effectively governed the region[^1^].
